alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Howard; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Borden, northwestern Howard, northeastern Martin and southeastern Dawson Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Lenorah, or 13 miles south of Ackerly, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Ackerly, Sand Springs, Luther, Knott and Vealmoor. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 176 and 182, and between mile markers 185 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for western Texas.
